title: Lone wolf  charged with shooting prime minister , Slovak interior minister says
message:
The Slovak interior minister said on Thursday that a “lone wolf” has been charged in the shooting that seriously wounded Prime Minister Robert Fico.
The attempted assassination has shocked the small central European nation, with leaders blaming the attack in part on extreme political polarisation that has divided the country.
Interior minister Matus Sutaj Estok told a press conference that the man charged did not belong to any political groups.
The interior minister said on Wednesday that an initial investigation found “a clear political motivation” behind the attack on Mr Fico while he was attending a government meeting in a former coal mining town.
However, he said Thursday that the suspect charged was a lone wolf who “did not belong to any political groups”.

title: Aid delivery to Gaza  almost impossible  amid intensified fighting : UN
message:

The UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said that distributing humanitarian aid "is almost impossible" in Gaza, due to the irregular fuel supply and interrupted communications amid intense fighting there.

title: Soldier from Michigan who died in Korean War accounted for more than 70 years later
message:
WASHINGTON -- A Michigan man who was killed in the Korean War has been accounted for according to the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency (DPAA).
Thomas A. Smith, 17 of Grant, Michigan, were accounted for on Sept. 22, 2023, nearly 70 years after he was presumed dead.
52 years later a plan was proposed to disinter the remains of 652 Korean War Unknowns and in March 2019, the remains were disinterred.
The DPAA used DPAA used dental and anthropological analysis to determine that Unknown X-5077 did in fact contain Smith’s remains.
While Smith’s name has been recorded at the Courts of the Missing at the Punchbowl along with other missing Korean War veterans, his name will now feature a rosette indicating he has been accounted for.

title: Slovakia PM Robert Fico not in life - threatening condition - International
message:
BBC- Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico is no longer in a life-threatening condition after being shot several times, the deputy prime minister has said.
Tomas Taraba told the BBC Mr Fico's surgery had gone "well" and "I guess that at the end he will survive".
Earlier Mr Fico, 59, was said to have been "fighting for his life" after being gravely injured in the attack in the small town of Handlova.
Mr Fico is a divisive figure at home - and controversial in the EU - for his calls to end military aid to Ukraine and sanctions on Russia.
The gunman fired five shots at close range and Mr Fico was hit in the stomach and in the arm.

title: Scientists ID remains of Michigan soldier killed in 1950 during Korean War
message:
Thomas A. Smith, 17 of Grant, Michigan, killed during the Korean War, has been accounted for.
In late 1950, the U.S. Army Quartermaster Corps (AGRSG) was responsible for recovering, identifying and repatriating those lost during the Korean War.
In February 1956, the remains were buried at the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific, known as the Punchbowl, in Honolulu, with other Korean War Unknowns.
In July 2018, the DPAA proposed a plan to disinter 652 Korean War Unknowns from the Punchbowl.
In March 2019, DPAA disinterred X-5077 as part of Phase One of the Korean War Disinterment Plan and sent the remains to the DPAA laboratory for analysis.
